name: Essentially Surjective Functor
definition: A **Functor** $F:C\to D$ is called **essentially surjective** if for every object $Y$ in $D$, there exists an object $X$ in $C$ such that $F(X)$ is isomorphic to $Y$ in $D$.
description: A #functor is essentially surjective when every object of $D$ is isomorphic to the image of some object of $C$.
